captions.text: Ro: Hey guys, it’s Ro!

Ro: Welcome to another Nerdy Nummies. Today
I have a special guest as you can see it’s Kevin!

Kevin: Hi, I’m Kevin. Ro: Haha, he’s from
VSauce 2, I’ll put his links down below.

Ro: We have baked together before, we’ve
baked a few things.

Kevin: Yeah, we’ve baked some, uh, cookies
that looked like glasses, we did a helping hands

Kevin: episode and got a little messy. Ro:
Yeah, and I asked Kevin to come help me bake today

Ro: because I got so many requests to do something
from Guardians of the Galaxy. And, I just

Ro: love that movie and my favorite character
is Groot! So today we’re gonna be making some
Ro: Groot treats. Kevin: Groot treats!
Ro: Let’s get started!

Ro: To make these treats, you’re gonna need
a bunch of things, but we’re gonna start off

Ro: with sugar cookie dough. You can use any
recipe you like, but we are using an instant one

Ro: because it is easy. So you’re gonna
need sugar cookie mix, an egg, and a sh-tick of butter.
Kevin: A sh-tick of butter!

Ro: And it’s at room temperature, you want
to make sure that it’s not frozen or stiff from the

Ro: fridge, that it’s… Kevin: Or melted!
Ro: Yeah, or melted. Kevin: Because then it won’t

Kevin: be a stick it will just be… Liquid.
Ro: It will just be mush.

Kevin: It will be a goop of butter. Ro: We’re
just gonna put all of these things into a big

Ro: mixing bowl, mix it together until it’s
evenly… Kevin: How was that? Ro: Perfect!
Kevin: OK, good.

Ro: It says tear here. Kevin: Did you have
your Wheaties this morning? Ro: I didn’t!

Kevin: I told you, you have to start your
day right. Now I have butter fingers,

Ro: Ah ah ah ah ah haha! Kevin: What is that
laugh? Is this your Count Chocula laugh?

Ro: Dig-uh-diga-diga-dee. Kevin: That’s
the pouring sound?

Ro: You can make a sound to crack the egg.
Kevin: OK, PWGGGGHHHHHHHH AHHHHHHH!!!!

Ro: Now that we got all the ingredients in
the bowl, we’re just gonna mix it together until

Ro: everything is combined. Kevin grab that
hand mixer, I’ll hold the bowl.

Kevin: Does this… How do you? Ro: You can
just put it on any speed. Kevin: Like this?

Ro: Yeah, that’s great. Kevin: And then
just? Ro: Yep. Kevin: Alright. Ro: OK.
Kevin: This is intense.

Ro: Great. Kevin: Now what? That looks like
ice cream. Haha don’t do that!

Ro: Yeah, have it hover and it will fling
off all the extra dough in the bowl.
Ro: Yeah higher, higher, higher. Kevin: How do I? Just doing that?
Both: OH NO!

Kevin: I hit the ejector button. Ro: Oh my
gosh, there’s an ejector button? See, I didn’t know

Ro: that. The whole time I’ve owned this
I’ve just been pulling them out.

Kevin: In case of emergency, just hit the
ejection button.

Ro: Once you’ve mixed together all of your
ingredients, now we are going to knead

Ro: the dough by hand. And add a bunch of
flour. Kevin: How much… Is that?

Ro: More, more, more! Kevin: More than this?
Ro: Yeah. Kevin: What is the proper

Kevin: height for this? Ro: I mean, that’s
pretty good. Kevin: Is this too high?

Kevin: Is that enough? A little bit more than
that. Ro: A little bit more.

Kevin: Is that too much? Ro: More! Kevin:
This is more? What about the whole bag? That’d be

Kevin: way too much! Ro: Go for it! Kevin:
OK. Ro: I feel like that’ll be fine, it’s fine!

Ro: This is maybe too much flour. Kevin: This
is a comical amount of flour.

Ro: So you’re gonna work your dough until
it’s this consistency, where it doesn’t stick to your

Ro: hands anymore. Take your rolling pin,
and we’re gonna roll it out flat.

Kevin: I don’t have a whole lot of experience
with this whole rolling thing. Ro: This looks good!

Kevin: But you know, OH NO! See, I told you!
Ro: Oh no! Kevin: Look at what happened!

Ro: Now, to make little Groot shapes, I’m
just going to be using a ginger bread man

Ro: cookie cutter. What you’re gonna do
is cut out your ginger bread man, take off the excess

Ro: dough, and I’m using him as a guide.
Now I’m gonna take a little knife and I’m gonna cut off
Ro: his little legs. Kevin: Oh no!

Ro: Because we’re kind of making baby Groot,
when he’s growing in his pot. Then I’m taking

Ro: another little cookie cutter, I’m taking
just a little rectangle, and I’m making his hair.

Ro: And then on his little arms, because he’s got
little tree arms.

Kevin: Yours looks like Groot, mine looks
like it really need help.

Ro: Then you’re just gonna make a bunch
more of these little cookies, put them on the tray,

Ro: heat your oven to 350 and you’re gonna
bake these for about 7 minutes. And while

Ro: these are baking, we are gonna be doing
a little bit of arts and crafts.

Kevin: Oh, good… Ro: Yep! For baby Groot
and his little pot.

Ro: Got these cute little planter pots, and,
we’ve found some acrylic paint. It is the color

Ro: Dolphin, that was the color gray from
the movie, it looked very similar. And we’ve got
Ro: these little sponge brushes.

Kevin: Now this paint is not edible right?
You don’t want to eat this?

Ro: Yeah, don’t eat the paint. Kevin: Or
the planter pot, don’t eat the planter pot?

Ro: Yeah, don’t eat the planter pot. Kevin:
OK.

Ro: Cookies just came out of the oven, and
now we are going to decorate. And so you’re just

Ro: going to take some brown cookie icing,
I put it in a plastic bag with a number 2 tip so

Ro: we’d have more control. And Kevin, I’m
gonna show you how to do this, are you ready?
Kevin: Alright, yes.

Ro: OK, so the first thing you’re gonna
do is just outline Groot’s little head and body.

Ro: And then, you’re just gonna fill it
in. And then I’m just taking a little toothpick and

Ro: connecting all of the cookie icing, and
it will help fill it in.

Kevin: Do you ever just squirt this right
in your mouth?

Ro: I have. Kevin: OK, I just wanted to make
sure, I would be really disappointed if you
Kevin: never tried that before.

Ro: Once you’ve iced all your cookies you’re
gonna then take your cookie icing and draw a few

Ro: little lines all over Groot. Kevin: So
bark. Ro: Does it look like bark? Make bark!

Kevin: Make bark! Now we’re gonna decorate
the faces, we’re going to use these mini chocolate

Kevin: chips for the eyeballs. Ro: Yum yum
yum yum. Kevin: Now what you want to do is you want to take

Kevin: your chocolate chip, and then you’re
gonna use the chocolate from here. Ro: Mmmhmm!

Kevin: As like, a little glue. Ro: Yeah, stick
it on the back. Kevin: And then eyeball Groot!

Kevin: Well Groot has 2 eyeballs. Ro: Yeah
he does. Kevin: So you’re gonna want to use 2

Kevin: chocolate chips. Ro: And then when
you’re done, you can make his smile
Ro: with the rest of the frosting.

Ro: Now it’s time to put everything together!
We’re gonna plant Groot!

Ro: So we’ve got our little pots, and here
I’ve pre-made some brownies. Just use your

Ro: favorite brownie recipe. So you’re gonna
take a spoonful of brownie and put him in your

Ro: little planter pot for dirt. Then I’m
gonna stick him right in the middle, oh he’s so cute!

Ro: Now once you’ve got little Groot in
there, you’re gonna take a little bit of Oreo crumbs.

Ro: These are really easy to make, you just
separate your Oreo, take off the good stuff, the

Ro: white stuff, and then I threw this in
the blender. And there you go, it’s Groot!

Kevin: Is this like 9,000 Oreos? How many
Oreos in this? Ro: I think it’s like 20 Oreos.

Kevin: What if you just ate this like it was
cereal? Ro: We should taste it. Kevin: OK.

Ro: OK, a little bite! Mmm! Kevin: WOW! That’s
actually delicious! Ro: It’s so good!

Ro: I’d put this on top of ice cream. Kevin:
I’d just put this on everything! Why not?

Both: Ta-da! Kevin: We made these great Groot
treats, from Guardians of the Galaxy and, um…

Kevin: I think they turned out pretty awesome.
What do you think? Pretty Groot!

Ro: Yeah, I think… Pretty Groot! Ha-ha-ha-ha.
Kevin: Wah-wah-wah-wah-wah!

Ro: I hope you guys liked these, thanks for
suggesting these, they were so much fun to make!

Ro: If you have any other ideas for any other
Nerdy Nummies, please let me know, leave

Ro: me a comment down below and I’ll do
my best to make it happen.

Ro: Also, a big thank you to Kevin for helping
me bake today, he is amazing! Again, I will put

Ro: his links down below, check him out. He’s
a pretty Groot guy! Kevin: Oh, thanks!

Ro: So many Groot jokes. OK, I’ll stop,
alright, thanks again you guys, bye-bye!
